description.narrative: - Armauer Hansen Research Institutes research and training activities strengthened - New and improved sustainable approaches for research and training developed -Investigations into epidemiology, zoonotic importance and economic impact of new disease areas carried out, contributing to meet MDG targets in health -Best practices in research and training established and maintained -Partner and donor coordination strategy strengthened and expanded

Poverty alleviation requires sustained economic growth, good governance and political stability. Education is a key element of the national reduction strategy and the current expansion of higher education institutions has created new conditions in Ethiopia for research and research training compared to earlier program periods.

description.narrative: To summarize results from such a long agreement period is of course very challenging, and hard to do just. They cover both research results, but also results in terms of capacity building of AHRI, to become a strong research environment. It appears no full, external evaluation of the Sida support AHRI has been conducted in a very long time. This could indeed be considered when preparing for the next phase of support, anticipated to start sometime during 2021/22.This year AHRI is conducting their own mid-term review of their five-year strategy, and a mid-term evaluation of the BSPP program under the current agreement. In summary (2013-2016): the focus of the agreement period was research (13 projects completed and six still ongoing), research dissemination (totally 159 international publications), postgraduate training (13 PhD and 26 MSc graduated), support to Ministry of Health activities and national programs (support with technical staff, conferences, development of National biotechnology Road Map Etc.), international networking (5 international collaborations started) and upgrade of infrastructure and scientific equipment (procurement of laboratory equipment, improved and expanded laboratory space). AHRI successfully delivered on almost all of the indicators of the agreed Results Framework, and some were carried forward to the next agreement period. AHRI is maintaining its leading position in health research in Ethiopia, and in late 2016 was upgraded to a federal research institute under the ministry of health. The new role will mean both challenges and opportunities for AHRI, and the next contribution was designed with that in mind.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
